name: Best-first feature selection with cross-validation
description: Find the best features for modeling using a greedy algorithm. Extends the best-first feature selection that only worked with models and used split-evaluation

inputs.name: dataset-id
inputs.description: The data to select features from

inputs.name: max-n
inputs.description: The number of maximum features (that is, dataset fields) to return. It also takes into account the pre-selected features

inputs.name: objective-id
inputs.description: Objective field ID, or empty for default dataset objective field

inputs.name: options
inputs.description: Configuration options to select the algorithm and its parametrization, e.g. 'number_of_models':40 will train ensembles. If empty, models will be train

inputs.name: k-folds
inputs.description: Number of k-folds in the cross-validation

inputs.name: pre-selected-fields
inputs.description: List of field IDs to be pre-selected as best features. The script won't consider them but they will be included in the output

inputs.name: early-stop-performance
inputs.description: An early-stop-performance improvement value (in %) used as a threshold to consider good performance of a feature

inputs.name: max-low-perf-iterations
inputs.description: Maximum number of iterations with low performance, as % of the number of initial features

outputs.name: output-features
outputs.description: The list of the selected features and some info from the performance of each iteration

outputs.name: output-dataset
outputs.description: the dataset with the selected features
